name: Utility
brief: Utility data structures and helpers used throughout the Orca API.

contents.name: oc_mat2x3_mul
contents.doc: Transforms a vector by an affine transformation represented as a 2x3 matrix.

return.name: oc_vec2
return.doc: The result vector.

params.name: m
params.doc: The input matrix. `m` holds an affine transformation. It is treated as a 3x3 matrix with an implicit `(0, 0, 1)` bottom row.

params.name: p
params.doc: The input vector. It is treated as a 3D homogeneous coordinate vector with an implicit z-coordinate equal to 1.

contents.name: oc_mat2x3_mul_m
contents.doc: Multiply two affine transformations represented as 2x3 matrices. Both matrices are treated as 3x3 matrices with an implicit `(0, 0, 1)` bottom row

return.name: oc_mat2x3
return.doc: The result matrix.

params.name: lhs
params.doc: The left-hand side matrix

params.name: rhs
params.doc: The right-hand side matrix

contents.name: oc_mat2x3_inv
contents.doc: Invert an affine transform represented as a 2x3 matrix.

return.name: oc_mat2x3
return.doc: The result matrix

params.name: x
params.doc: The input matrix. It is treated as a 3x3 matrix with an implicit `(0, 0, 1)` bottom row.

contents.name: oc_mat2x3_rotate
contents.doc: Return a 2x3 matrix representing a rotation.

return.name: oc_mat2x3
return.doc: The resulting rotation.

params.name: radians
params.doc: The rotation angle, in radians.

contents.name: oc_mat2x3_translate
contents.doc: Return a 2x3 matrix representing a translation.

return.name: oc_mat2x3
return.doc: The resulting translation.

params.name: x
params.doc: The first component of the translation.

params.name: y
params.doc: The second component of the translation.

contents.name: Debug
contents.brief: Helpers for logging, asserting and aborting.

contents.name: oc_abort_ext
doc: Abort the application, showing an error message.
This function should not be called directly by user code, which should use the `OC_ABORT` macro instead, as the macro takes care of filling in the source location parameters of the function.

params.name: file
params.doc: The name of the source file the abort originates from.

params.name: function
params.doc: The name of the function the abort originates from.

params.name: line
params.doc: The source line the abort originates from.

params.name: fmt
params.doc: The format string of the abort message similar to `printf()`.
Additional arguments for the abort message.

contents.name: oc_assert_fail
doc: Tigger a failed assertion. This aborts the application, showing the failed assertion and an error message.

This function should not be called directly by user code, which should use the `OC_ASSERT` macro instead. The macro checks the assert condition and calls the function if it is false. It also takes care of filling in the source location parameters of the function.

params.name: file
params.doc: The name of the source file the failed assertion originates from.

params.name: function
params.doc: The name of the function the failed assertion originates from.

params.name: line
params.doc: The source line the failed assertion originates from.

params.name: src
params.doc: The source code of the failed assert condition.

params.name: fmt
params.doc: The format string of the error message, similar to `printf()`.
Additional arguments for the error message.

contents.name: oc_log_level
contents.doc: Constants allowing to specify the level of logging verbosity.

constants.name: OC_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR
constants.doc: Only errors are logged.

constants.name: OC_LOG_LEVEL_WARNING
constants.doc: Only warnings and errors are logged.

constants.name: OC_LOG_LEVEL_INFO
constants.doc: All messages are logged.

contents.name: oc_log_set_level
contents.doc: Set the logging verbosity.

params.name: level
params.doc: The desired logging level. Messages whose level is below this threshold will not be logged.

contents.name: oc_log_ext
doc: Log a message to the console.

This function should not be called directly by user code, which should use the `oc_log_XXX` family of macros instead. The macros take care of filling in the message level and source location parameters of the function.

params.name: level
params.doc: The logging level of the message.

params.name: function
params.doc: The name of the function the message originated from

params.name: file
params.doc: The name of the source file the message originated from

params.name: line
params.doc: The source line the message originated from

params.name: fmt
params.doc: The format string of the message, similar to `printf()`.
Additional arguments of the message

contents.name: oc_log_error
contents.doc: Log an error to the console.

params.name: msg
params.doc: The format string of the message, similar to `printf()`.
Additional arguments of the message.

contents.name: oc_log_warning
contents.doc: Log a warning to the console.

params.name: msg
params.doc: The format string of the message, similar to `printf()`.
Additional arguments of the message.

contents.name: oc_log_info
contents.doc: Log a informative message to the console.

params.name: msg
params.doc: The format string of the message, similar to `printf()`.
Additional arguments of the message.

contents.name: OC_ABORT
contents.doc: Abort the application with an optional error message.

params.doc: An optional format string for the error message, followed by additional message arguments, similar to `printf()`.

contents.name: OC_ASSERT
contents.doc: Test a given condition, and abort the application if it is false.

params.name: test
params.doc: The condition expression to test.
An optional format string for the error message, followed by additional message arguments, similar to `printf()`.

contents.name: OC_DEBUG_ASSERT
contents.doc: Similar to `OC_ASSERT`, but only run in Debug mode.

params.name: test
params.doc: The condition expression to test.
An optional format string for the error message, followed by additional message arguments, similar to `printf()`.

contents.name: Lists
contents.brief: Types and helpers for doubly-linked lists.

contents.name: oc_list_begin
contents.doc: Get the first element of a list.

params.name: l
params.doc: An `oc_list` list.

return.doc: A pointer to the first `oc_list_elt` of the list.

contents.name: oc_list_last
contents.doc: Returns the last element of a list.

params.name: l
params.doc: An `oc_list` list.

return.doc: A pointer to the last `oc_list_elt` of the list.

contents.name: oc_list_next
contents.doc: Get the next element in a list.

params.name: elt
params.doc: A pointer to an `oc_list_elt` element in a list.

return.doc: A pointer to the next element in the list.

contents.name: oc_list_prev
contents.doc: Get the previous element in a list.

params.name: elt
params.doc: A pointer to an `oc_list_elt` element in a list.

return.doc: A pointer to the previous element in the list.

contents.name: oc_list_entry
contents.doc: Get the entry for a given list element.

params.name: elt
params.doc: A pointer to an `oc_list_elt` element.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the `oc_list_elt` field in `type` by which the entry is linked into the list.

return.doc: A pointer to the entry of type `type` which is linked into the list by element `elt`.

contents.name: oc_list_next_entry
contents.doc: Get the next entry in a list.

params.name: elt
params.doc: A pointer to an `oc_list_elt` element in that list.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the `oc_list_elt` field in `type` by which the entry is linked into the list.

return.doc: A pointer to the entry of type `type` which is linked into the list after element `elt`.

contents.name: oc_list_prev_entry
contents.doc: Get the previous entry in a list.

params.name: elt
params.doc: A pointer to an `oc_list_elt` element in that list.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the `oc_list_elt` field in `type` by which the entry is linked into the list.

return.doc: A pointer to the entry of type `type` which is linked into the list before element `elt`.

contents.name: oc_list_checked_entry
contents.doc: Same as `oc_list_entry`, but `elt` might be null.

params.name: elt
params.doc: A pointer to an `oc_list_elt` element.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the `oc_list_elt` field in `type` by which the entry is linked into the list.

return.doc: If `elt` is null, the macro returns a null pointer. Otherwise it returns a pointer to the entry of type `type` which is linked into the list by element `elt`.

contents.name: oc_list_first_entry
contents.doc: Get the first entry of a list.

params.name: list
params.doc: An `oc_list` object.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the `oc_list_elt` field in `type` by which the entry is linked into the list.

return.doc: A pointer to the entry of type `type` which is the first entry in the list.

contents.name: oc_list_last_entry
contents.doc: Get the last entry of a list.

params.name: list
params.doc: An `oc_list` object.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the `oc_list_elt` field in `type` by which the entry is linked into the list.

return.doc: A pointer to the entry of type `type` which is the last entry in the list.

contents.name: oc_list_for
doc: Loop through a linked list.

This macro creates a loop with an iterator named after the `elt` macro parameter. The iterator is of the type specified by the `type` macro parameter, which must be the type of the entries linked in the list.
You should follow this macro with the loop body, where you can use the iterator.

params.name: list
params.doc: An `oc_list` object.

params.name: elt
params.doc: The name of the loop iterator.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the loop iterator. This must be the type of the entries linked in `list`.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the field of type `oc_list_elt` in `type` by which the list entries are linked.

contents.note: You should not add or remove elements from the list inside the loop body. If you need to do so, use `oc_list_for_safe` instead.

contents.name: oc_list_for_reverse
contents.doc: Loop through a linked list from last to first. See `oc_list_for` for details.

params.name: list
params.doc: An `oc_list` object.

params.name: elt
params.doc: The name of the loop iterator.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the loop iterator. This must be the type of the entries linked in `list`.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the field of type `oc_list_elt` in `type` by which the list entries are linked.

contents.name: oc_list_for_safe
contents.doc: Loop through a linked list in a way that allows adding or removing elements from it in the loop body. See `oc_list_for` for more details.

params.name: list
params.doc: An `oc_list` object.

params.name: elt
params.doc: The name of the loop iterator.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the loop iterator. This must be the type of the entries linked in `list`.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the field of type `oc_list_elt` in `type` by which the list entries are linked.

contents.name: oc_list_pop_front_entry
contents.doc: Remove the first entry from a list and return it.

params.name: list
params.doc: An `oc_list` object.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the field of type `oc_list_elt` in `type` by which the list entries are linked.

return.doc: A pointer of type `type` to the entry that was removed from the list.

contents.name: oc_list_pop_back_entry
contents.doc: Remove the last entry from a list and return it.

params.name: list
params.doc: An `oc_list` object.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the entry to retrieve.

params.name: member
params.doc: The name of the field of type `oc_list_elt` in `type` by which the list entries are linked.

return.doc: A pointer of type `type` to the entry that was removed from the list.

contents.name: oc_mem_reserve_proc
contents.doc: The prototype of a procedure to reserve memory from the system.

contents.name: oc_mem_modify_proc
contents.doc: The prototype of a procedure to modify a memory reservation.

contents.doc: A structure that defines how to allocate memory from the system.

fields.name: reserve
fields.doc: A procedure to reserve memory from the system.

fields.name: commit

contents.name: oc_arena_chunk
contents.doc: A contiguous chunk of memory managed by a memory arena.

contents.name: oc_arena
contents.doc: A memory arena, allowing to allocate memory in a linear or stack-like fashion.

fields.name: base
fields.doc: An allocator providing memory pages from the system

fields.name: chunks
fields.doc: A list of `oc_arena_chunk` chunks.

fields.name: currentChunk
fields.doc: The chunk new memory allocations are pulled from.

contents.name: oc_arena_scope
contents.doc: This struct provides a way to store the current offset in a given arena, in order to reset the arena to that offset later. This allows using arenas in a stack-like fashion, e.g. to create temporary "scratch" allocations

fields.name: arena
fields.doc: The arena which offset is stored.

fields.name: chunk
fields.doc: The arena chunk to which the offset belongs.

fields.name: offset
fields.doc: The offset to rewind the arena to.

contents.name: oc_arena_options
contents.doc: Options for arena creation.

fields.name: base
fields.doc: The base allocator to use with this arena

fields.name: reserve
fields.doc: The amount of memory to reserve up-front when creating the arena.

contents.name: oc_arena_init
contents.doc: Initialize a memory arena.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena to initialize.

contents.name: oc_arena_init_with_options
contents.doc: Initialize a memory arena with additional options.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena to initialize.

params.name: options
params.doc: The options to use to initialize the arena.

contents.name: oc_arena_cleanup
contents.doc: Release all resources allocated to a memory arena.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena to cleanup.

contents.name: oc_arena_push
contents.doc: Allocate a block of memory from an arena.

return.doc: A pointer to the allocated memory.

params.name: arena
params.doc: An arena to allocate memory from.

params.name: size
params.doc: The size of the memory to allocate, in bytes.

contents.name: oc_arena_push_aligned
contents.doc: Allocate an aligned block of memory from an arena.

return.doc: A pointer to the allocated memory

params.name: arena
params.doc: An arena to allocate memory from.

params.name: size
params.doc: The size of the memory to allocate, in bytes.

params.name: alignment
params.doc: The desired alignment of the memory block, in bytes

contents.name: oc_arena_clear
contents.doc: Reset an arena. All memory that was previously allocated from this arena is released to the arena, and can be reallocated by later calls to `oc_arena_push` and similar functions. No memory is actually released _to the system_.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena to clear.

contents.name: oc_arena_scope_begin
contents.doc: Begin a memory scope. This creates an `oc_arena_scope` object that stores the current offset of the arena. The arena can later be reset to that offset by calling `oc_arena_scope_end`, releasing all memory that was allocated within the scope to the arena.

return.name: oc_arena_scope
return.doc: A `oc_arena_scope` object storing the current offset of the arena.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena for which the scope is created.

contents.name: oc_arena_scope_end
contents.doc: End a memory scope. This resets an arena to the offset it had when the scope was created. All memory allocated within the scope is released back to the arena.

params.name: scope
params.doc: An `oc_arena_scope` object that was created by a call to `oc_arena_scope_begin()`.

contents.name: oc_scratch_begin
doc: Begin a scratch scope. This creates a memory scope on a per-thread, global "scratch" arena. This allows easily creating temporary memory for scratch computations or intermediate results, in a stack-like fashion.

If you must return results in an arena passed by the caller, and you also use a scratch arena to do intermediate computations, beware that the results arena could itself be a scatch arena. In this case, you have to be careful not to intermingle your scratch computations with the final result, or clear your result entirely. You can either:
- Allocate memory for the result upfront and call `oc_scratch_begin` afterwards, if possible.
- Use `oc_scratch_begin_next()` and pass it the result arena, to get a scratch arena that does not conflict with it.

return.name: oc_arena_scope
return.doc: A memory scope object. You can use the `arena` field of this object to allocate memory from the scratch scope. When you're done, pass the scope oject to `oc_scratch_end()`.

contents.name: oc_scratch_begin_next
contents.doc: Begin a scratch scope that does not conflict with a given arena. See `oc_scratch_begin()` for more details about when to use this function.

return.name: oc_arena_scope
return.doc: A memory scope object. You can use the `arena` field of this object to allocate memory from the scratch scope. When you're done, pass the scope oject to `oc_scratch_end()`.

params.name: used
params.doc: A pointer to a memory arena that the scratch scope shouldn't interfere with.

contents.doc: Allocate a type from an arena. This macro takes care of the memory alignment and type cast.
contents.name: oc_arena_push_type

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena to allocate from.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the object to allocate.

return.doc: A pointer to the allocated object.

contents.name: oc_arena_push_array
contents.doc: Allocate an array from an arena. This macro takes care of the size calculation, memory alignment and type cast.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena to allocate from.

params.name: type
params.doc: The type of the array's elements.

params.name: count
params.doc: The number of element in the array.

return.doc: A pointer to the allocated array.

contents.name: oc_scratch_end
contents.doc: End a scratch scope.

params.name: scope
params.doc: A scope object created by a call to `oc_scratch_begin()` or similar functions.

contents.name: oc_str8
contents.doc: A type representing a string of bytes.

fields.name: ptr
fields.doc: A pointer to the string's bytes.

fields.name: len
fields.doc: The length of the string.

contents.name: OC_STR8
contents.doc: Makes an `oc_str8` string from a C null-terminated string.

params.name: s
params.doc: A null-terminated string.

return.doc: An `oc_str8` struct pointing to s.

contents.name: oc_str8_lp
doc: Expands a string `s` to `s.len, s.ptr`
You can use this macro when calling functions that expect a `size_t` length and pointer arguments.

params.name: s
params.doc: The `oc_str8` string to expand.

contents.name: oc_str8_ip
doc: Expands a string `s` to `(int)s.len, s.ptr`.
You can use this macro when calling functions that expect an `i32` length and pointer arguments, for example:
printf(".*s", oc_str8_lp(s));

params.name: s
params.doc: The `oc_str8` string to expand.

contents.name: oc_str8_from_buffer
contents.doc: Make a string from a bytes buffer and a length.

return.name: oc_str8
return.doc: The resulting string.

type.doc: The length of the buffer, in bytes.

params.name: buffer
params.doc: A buffer of bytes.

contents.name: oc_str8_slice
contents.doc: Make a string from a slice of another string. The resulting string designates some subsequence of the input string.

return.name: oc_str8
return.doc: The resulting string slice.

params.name: start
params.doc: The inclusive start index of the slice.

params.name: end
params.doc: The exclusive end index of the slice.

contents.note: The slice covers indices from `start` to `end-1`. `start` must be inferior or equal to `end`, and `end` must be inferior or equal to ``s.len`.

contents.name: oc_str8_push_buffer
contents.doc: Pushes a copy of a buffer to an arena, and makes a string refering to that copy.

return.name: oc_str8
return.doc: A string designating the copy of the input buffer.

type.doc: The arena on which to copy the input buffer.

params.name: len
params.doc: The length of the buffer.

params.name: buffer
params.doc: The buffer to copy.

contents.name: oc_str8_push_cstring
contents.doc: Pushes a copy of a C null-terminated string to an arena, and makes a string referring to that copy.

return.name: oc_str8
return.doc: A string referring to the copy of the input string.

type.doc: The arena on which to copy the input buffer.

params.name: str
params.doc: A null-terminated string.

contents.name: oc_str8_push_copy
contents.doc: Copy the contents of a string on an arena and make a new string referring to the copied bytes.

return.name: oc_str8
return.doc: A string referring to the copy of the contents of the input string.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena on which to copy the contents of the input string.

params.name: s
params.doc: The input string.

contents.name: oc_str8_push_slice
contents.doc: Make a copy of a string slice. This function copies a subsequence of the input string onto an arena, and returns a new string referring to the copied content.

params.name: arena
params.doc: The arena on which to copy the slice of the input string.

params.name: s

contents.name: oc_utf8_status
contents.doc: This enum declares the possible return status of UTF8 decoding/encoding operations.

constants.name: OC_UTF8_OK
constants.doc: The operation was successful.

constants.name: OC_UTF8_OUT_OF_BOUNDS
constants.doc: The operation unexpectedly encountered the end of the utf8 sequence.

constants.name: OC_UTF8_UNEXPECTED_CONTINUATION_BYTE
constants.doc: A continuation byte was encountered where a leading byte was expected.

constants.name: OC_UTF8_UNEXPECTED_LEADING_BYTE
constants.doc: A leading byte was encountered in the middle of the encoding of utf8 codepoint.

constants.name: OC_UTF8_INVALID_BYTE
constants.doc: The utf8 sequence contains an invalid byte.

constants.name: OC_UTF8_INVALID_CODEPOINT
constants.doc: The operation encountered an invalid utf8 codepoint.

constants.name: OC_UTF8_OVERLONG_ENCODING
constants.doc: The utf8 sequence contains an overlong encoding of a utf8 codepoint.

contents.name: oc_utf8_size_from_leading_char

params.doc: The first byte of utf8 sequence.

params.name: codePoints
params.doc: A sequence of unicode codepoints.

contents.doc: Get the offset of the next codepoint after a given offset, in a utf8 encoded string.

return.doc: The offset of the start of the encoding of the next codepoint, in bytes.

params.name: string
params.doc: A utf8 encoded string.

contents.name: oc_event_type
contents.doc: This enum defines the type events that can be sent to the application by the runtime. This determines which member of the `oc_event` union field is active.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_NONE
constants.doc: No event. That could be used simply to wake up the application.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_KEYBOARD_MODS
constants.doc: A modifier key event. This event is sent when a key such as <kbd>Alt</kbd>, <kbd>Control</kbd>, <kbd>Command</kbd> or <kbd>Shift</kbd> are pressed, released, or repeated. The `key` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_KEYBOARD_KEY
constants.doc: A key event. This event is sent when a normal key is pressed, released, or repeated. The `key` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_KEYBOARD_CHAR
constants.doc: A character input event. This event is sent when an input character is produced by the keyboard. The `character` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_MOUSE_BUTTON
constants.doc: A mouse button event. This is event sent when one of the mouse buttons is pressed, released, or clicked. The `key` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_MOUSE_MOVE
constants.doc: A mouse move event. This is event sent when the mouse is moved. The `mouse` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_MOUSE_WHEEL
constants.doc: A mouse wheel event. This is event sent when the mouse wheel is moved (or when a trackpad is scrolled). The `mouse` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_MOUSE_ENTER
constants.doc: A mouse enter event. This event is sent when the mouse enters the application's window. The `mouse` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_MOUSE_LEAVE
constants.doc: A mouse leave event. This event is sent when the mouse leaves the application's window.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_CLIPBOARD_PASTE
constants.doc: A clipboard paste event. This event is sent when the user uses the paste shortcut while the application window has focus.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_WINDOW_RESIZE
constants.doc: A resize event. This event is sent when the application's window is resized. The `move` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_WINDOW_MOVE
constants.doc: A move event. This event is sent when the window is moved. The `move` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_WINDOW_FOCUS
constants.doc: A focus event. This event is sent when the application gains focus.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_WINDOW_UNFOCUS
constants.doc: An unfocus event. This event is sent when the application looses focus.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_WINDOW_HIDE
constants.doc: A hide event. This event is sent when the application's window is hidden or minimized.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_WINDOW_SHOW
constants.doc: A show event. This event is sent when the application's window is shown or de-minimized.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_WINDOW_CLOSE
constants.doc: A close event. This event is sent when the window is about to be closed.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_PATHDROP
constants.doc: A path drop event. This event is sent when the user drops files onto the application's window. The `paths` field contains the event's details.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_FRAME
constants.doc: A frame event. This event is sent when the application should render a frame.

constants.name: OC_EVENT_QUIT
constants.doc: A quit event. This event is sent when the application has been requested to quit.

contents.name: oc_key_action
contents.doc: This enum describes the actions that can happen to a key.

constants.name: OC_KEY_NO_ACTION
constants.doc: No action happened on that key.

constants.name: OC_KEY_PRESS
constants.doc: The key was pressed.

constants.name: OC_KEY_RELEASE
constants.doc: The key was released.

constants.name: OC_KEY_REPEAT
constants.doc: The key was maintained pressed at least for the system's key repeat period.

contents.name: oc_scan_code
contents.doc: A code representing a key's physical location. This is independent of the system's keyboard layout.

contents.name: oc_key_code
contents.doc: A code identifying a key. The physical location of the key corresponding to a given key code depends on the system's keyboard layout.

contents.name: oc_mouse_button
contents.doc: A code identifying a mouse button.

contents.name: oc_key_event
contents.doc: A structure describing a key event or a mouse button event.

fields.name: action
fields.doc: The action that was done on the key.

fields.name: scanCode
fields.doc: The scan code of the key. Only valid for key events.

fields.name: keyCode
fields.doc: The key code of the key. Only valid for key events.

fields.name: button
fields.doc: The button of the mouse. Only valid for mouse button events.

fields.name: mods
fields.doc: Modifier flags indicating which modifier keys where pressed at the time of the event.

fields.name: clickCount
fields.doc: The number of clicks that where detected for the button. Only valid for mouse button events.

contents.name: oc_char_event
contents.doc: A structure describing a character input event.

fields.name: codepoint
fields.doc: The unicode codepoint of the character.

fields.name: sequence
fields.doc: The utf8 sequence of the character.

fields.name: seqLen
fields.doc: The utf8 sequence length.

contents.name: oc_mouse_event
contents.doc: A structure describing a mouse move or a mouse wheel event. Mouse coordinates have their origin at the top-left corner of the window, with the y axis going down.

fields.name: x
fields.doc: The x coordinate of the mouse.

fields.name: y
fields.doc: The y coordinate of the mouse.

fields.name: deltaX
fields.doc: The delta from the last x coordinate of the mouse, or the scroll value along the x coordinate.

fields.name: deltaY
fields.doc: The delta from the last y coordinate of the mouse, or the scoll value along the y  coordinate.

fields.name: mods
fields.doc: Modifier flags indicating which modifier keys where pressed at the time of the event.

contents.name: oc_move_event
contents.doc: A structure describing a window move or resize event.

fields.name: frame
fields.doc: The position and dimension of the frame rectangle, i.e. including the window title bar and border.

fields.name: content
fields.doc: The position and dimension of the content rectangle, relative to the frame rectangle.

contents.name: oc_event
contents.doc: A structure describing an event sent to the application.

fields.name: window
fields.doc: The window in which this event happened.

fields.name: type
fields.doc: The type of the event. This determines which member of the event union is active.

fields.name: key
fields.doc: Details for a key or mouse button event.

fields.name: character
fields.doc: Details for a character input event.

fields.name: mouse
fields.doc: Details for a mouse move or mouse wheel event.

fields.name: move
fields.doc: Details for a window move or resize event.

fields.name: paths
fields.doc: Details for a drag and drop event.

_oc_file_dialog_flags

constants.doc: This dialog allows selecting files.

constants.name: OC_FILE_DIALOG_DIRECTORIES

constants.name: OC_FILE_DIALOG_MULTIPLE
constants.doc: This dialog allows selecting multiple items.

constants.name: OC_FILE_DIALOG_CREATE_DIRECTORIES
constants.doc: This dialog allows creating directories.

contents.name: oc_file_dialog_desc
contents.doc: A structure describing a file dialog.

fields.name: kind
fields.doc: The kind of file dialog, see `oc_file_dialog_kind`.

fields.name: flags

fields.name: title

fields.name: okLabel

fields.name: startAt
fields.doc: Optional. A file handle to the root directory for the dialog. If set to zero, the root directory is the application's default data directory.

fields.name: startPath
fields.doc: Optional. The path of the starting directory of the dialog, relative to its root directory. If set to nil, the dialog starts at its root directory.

fields.name: filters
fields.doc: A list of file extensions used to restrict which files can be selected in this dialog. An empty list allows all files to be selected. Extensions should be provided without a leading dot.

fields.name: selection

contents.name: File API
contents.brief: API for opening, reading and writing files.

contents.name: oc_file
contents.doc: An opaque handle identifying an opened file.

fields.name: h
fields.doc: Opaque file handle.

contents.name: oc_file_open_flags
contents.doc: The type of file open flags describing file open options.

contents.name: oc_file_open_flags_enum
contents.doc: Flags for the `oc_file_open()` function.

constants.name: OC_FILE_OPEN_NONE
constants.doc: No options.

constants.name: OC_FILE_OPEN_APPEND
constants.doc: Open the file in 'append' mode. All writes append data at the end of the file.

constants.name: OC_FILE_OPEN_TRUNCATE
constants.doc: Truncate the file to 0 bytes when opening.

constants.name: OC_FILE_OPEN_CREATE
constants.doc: Create the file if it does not exist.

constants.name: OC_FILE_OPEN_SYMLINK
constants.doc: If the file is a symlink, open the symlink itself instead of following it.

constants.name: OC_FILE_OPEN_NO_FOLLOW
constants.doc: If the file is a symlink, the call to open will fail.

constants.name: OC_FILE_OPEN_RESTRICT
constants.doc: Reserved.

contents.name: oc_file_access_enum
contents.doc: This enum describes the access permissions of a file handle.

constants.name: OC_FILE_ACCESS_NONE
constants.doc: The file handle has no access permissions.

constants.name: OC_FILE_ACCESS_READ
constants.doc: The file handle can be used for reading from the file.

constants.name: OC_FILE_ACCESS_WRITE
constants.doc: The file handle can be used for writing to the file.

contents.name: oc_file_whence
contents.doc: This enum is used in `oc_file_seek()` to specify the starting point of the seek operation.

constants.name: OC_FILE_SEEK_SET
constants.doc: Set the file position relative to the beginning of the file.

constants.name: OC_FILE_SEEK_END
constants.doc: Set the file position relative to the end of the file.

constants.name: OC_FILE_SEEK_CURRENT
constants.doc: Set the file position relative to the current position.

contents.name: oc_io_req_id
contents.doc: A type used to identify I/O requests.
A type used to identify I/O operations.
contents.name: oc_io_op
oc_io_op_enum
contents.doc: This enum declares all I/O operations.

constants.name: OC_IO_OPEN_AT
doc: Open a file at a path relative to a given root directory.
- `handle` is the handle to the root directory. If it is nil, the application's default directory is used.
- `size` is the size of the path, in bytes.
- `buffer` points to an array containing the path of the file to open, relative to the directory identified by `handle`.
- `open` contains the permissions and flags for the open operation.

constants.name: OC_IO_CLOSE
doc: Close a file handle.
- `handle` is the handle to close.

constants.name: OC_IO_FSTAT
doc: Get status information for a file handle.
- `handle` is the handle to stat.
- `size` is the size of the result buffer. It should be at least `sizeof(oc_file_status)`.
- `buffer` is the result buffer.

constants.name: OC_IO_SEEK
doc: Move the file position in a file.
- `handle` is the handle of the file.
- `offset` specifies the offset of the new position, relative to the base position specified by `whence`.
- `whence` determines the base position for the seek operation.
Read data from a file.
- `handle` is the handle of the file.
- `size` is the number of bytes to read.
- `buffer` is the result buffer. It should be big enough to hold `size` bytes.
constants.name: OC_IO_READ
OC_IO_WRITE
doc: Write data to a file.
- `handle` is the handle of the file.
- `size` is the number of bytes to write.
- `buffer` contains the data to write to the file.

constants.name: OC_OC_IO_ERROR
doc: Get the error attached to a file handle.
- `handle` is the handle of the file.

contents.name: oc_io_req
contents.doc: A structure describing an I/O request.

fields.name: id
fields.doc: An identifier for the request. You can set this to any value you want. It is passed back in the `oc_io_cmp` completion and can be used to match requests and completions.

fields.name: op
fields.doc: The requested operation.

fields.name: handle
fields.doc: A file handle used by some operations.

fields.name: offset
fields.doc: An offset used by some operations.

fields.name: size
fields.doc: A size indicating the capacity of the buffer pointed to by `buffer`, in bytes.

fields.name: buffer
fields.doc: A buffer used to pass data to the request or get back results.

fields.name: unused
fields.doc: reserved

fields.name: open
fields.doc: Holds options for the open operations.

fields.name: rights
fields.doc: The access permissions requested on the file to open.

fields.name: flags
fields.doc: The options to use when opening the file.

fields.name: whence
fields.doc: The base position to use in seek operations.

contents.name: oc_io_error
contents.doc: A type identifying an I/O error.

contents.name: oc_io_error_enum
contents.doc: This enum declares all I/O error values.

constants.name: OC_IO_OK
constants.doc: No error.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_UNKNOWN
constants.doc: An unexpected error happened.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_OP
constants.doc: The request had an invalid operation.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_HANDLE
constants.doc: The request had an invalid handle.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_PREV
constants.doc: The operation was not carried out because the file handle has previous errors.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_ARG
constants.doc: The request contained wrong arguments.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_PERM
constants.doc: The operation requires permissions that the file handle doesn't have.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_SPACE
constants.doc: The operation couldn't complete due to a lack of space in the result buffer.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_NO_ENTRY
constants.doc: One of the directory in the path does not exist or couldn't be traversed.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_EXISTS
constants.doc: The file already exists.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_NOT_DIR
constants.doc: The file is not a directory.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_DIR
constants.doc: The file is a directory.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_MAX_FILES
constants.doc: There are too many opened files.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_MAX_LINKS
constants.doc: The path contains too many symbolic links (this may be indicative of a symlink loop).

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_PATH_LENGTH
constants.doc: The path is too long.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_FILE_SIZE
constants.doc: The file is too large.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_OVERFLOW
constants.doc: The file is too large to be opened.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_NOT_READY
constants.doc: The file is locked or the device on which it is stored is not ready.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_MEM
constants.doc: The system is out of memory.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_INTERRUPT
constants.doc: The operation was interrupted by a signal.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_PHYSICAL
constants.doc: A physical error happened.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_NO_DEVICE
constants.doc: The device on which the file is stored was not found.

constants.name: OC_IO_ERR_WALKOUT
constants.doc: One element along the path is outside the root directory subtree.
